reviewText: Darwin published Origin of Species more than 150 years ago, and science never sits still. This excellent program explores some of the major advances in evolutionary theory since then. Our modern theory of evolution is much deeper and more complex than Darwin's original theory. "What Darwin Never Knew" examines new aspects of our understanding, as well as looking at the large amount of evidence we have available that didn't exist in 1859.One of those nature vids that every person should see.
Title: N/A

reviewText: The first half is a good basic review/introduction to Darwin, his life, his theories, and what evolution is.  The second half shows more details, latest research, including the quest to excavate the transitional specie (from water to land), and they found it, whoo hoo!, near the Arctic.  Also to show that Darwin was right about his theories and that today's research help to substantiate it.  Also a look into gene expression, turning certain parts of DNA on or off.  My favorite scene is when they show how a mutation in the gorilla causing Lou Gering's muscular dystrophy resulting in a weakening of our jaw muscles may have caused a slower fusion of growth plates in our skull.  Recently released '09, quality is definitely up to par as today's standards of NOVA PBS science.  Amazing graphics, color details of animals, 1080p, 16:9 widescr, etc.  Total: 2 hrs.  Highly recommended.  Thank you PBS.
summary: By golly, Galileo was right all this time, says Neil Armstrong dropping a hammer and a feather.  So was Darwin, if he only knew.
Title: N/A

reviewText: We take our first baby steps to understanding our world and it's history.This film illustrates some of those steps.Stunning HD presentation.By now it should be painfully obvious that evolution is fact.However, there are 18 letters (DNA) that make humans different from chimps.IMHO I think there might have been some manipulation at some point. Proof of that would be the real stunner...Who? What? When? Why?I had a heart attack a year ago. Time for me is precious. I do NOT waste it now. Time watching this film is time well spent indeed!Highly recommended."How the Earth was made" (History channel) is another very good DVD too.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This video is nothing like the "Life" series that shows different animals in their environments - Instead this video is about genealogy and how and why all animals and humans have so much of the same genetic code and how and why it effects everything! Do not miss this, you might think it is nerdy because of the title, but you will be mesmerized and want to show this to all of your friends and family as soon as you see the first 10 minutes, you will not be able to turn it off. Excellent.
